roleset.name: carry by tugging
roleset.note: TUG-V NOTES: This and tug.03 are very similar--tug.03 is a resultative, tug.01 ismore directional. Member of Vncls carry-11.4. (from tug.01-v)

example.name: compare with tug.03
example.text: John tugged his heavy cedar chest to the center of the hallway.
example.arg: to the center of the hallway

roleset.name: pull (on)
roleset.note: TUG-V NOTES: Member of Vncls hold-15.1-1, push-12-1, touch-20-1. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from tug.02-v)

example.name: Picard maneuver
example.text: John tugs on the hem of his shirt whenever he stands up.
example.arg: on the hem of his shirt

roleset.name: pull with end result
roleset.note: TUG-V NOTES: Member of Vncls split-23.2, push-12-1. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from tug.03-v)

role.descr: other thing tugged or secondary attribute, result of arg1

example.name: not tug apart
example.text: But yesterday, the heavy trading action eventually consumed not only Messrs. Jacobson and Bates but [four other Jacobson partners]-1, all doing their specialist-firm job of *trace*-1 tugging buyers and sellers together and adjusting prices to accommodate the market.
